maml:description.maml:para: Enter-Test initializes unit test Must be called before first test case in single unit test and in pair with Exit-Test

maml:Description.maml:para: If specified temporarily exports private module functions into global scope
Should be specified to enter pester tests for private functions, this parameter implies -Private switch.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
If specified temporarily exports private module functions into global scope
Should be specified to enter pester tests for private functions, this parameter implies -Private switch.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Enter-Test
None. Enter-Test does not generate any output

maml:description.maml:para: Exit-Test performs finishing steps after unit test is done, ie. to restore previous state Must be called in pair with Enter-Test and after all test cases are done in single unit test

maml:Description.maml:para: Should be specified to exit private function pester test
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: New-Section prints new section to group multiple test cases. Useful for unit test with a lof of test cases, for readability.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove all items from test drive

Test drive is directory where test cases may output their results. This function clears test directory leaving empty test drive only. If the test drive does not exist new one is created. For safety reasons, when non default test drive is specified the function will complete operation only if run as standard user, in which case it prompts for confirmation.

maml:Description.maml:para: Test drive location. The default is "TestDrive" directory inside well known project test directory.
Specify the number of times this function will repeat an attempt to clear test drive. This is needed in cases such as when contents are in use by another process.
The timeout interval (in milliseconds) between each retry attempt
Skip prompting clearing non default test drive. This parameter has no effect if the function is run with non standard user privileges.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Start-Test writes output to host to separate test cases. Formatted message block is shown in the console. This function must be called before single test case starts executing

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Test each link in markdown file and report if any link is dead

maml:Description.maml:para: The path to directory containing target markdown files
If specified, recurse in to the path specified by Path parameter
Specifies how long the request can be pending before it times out
Specifies how many times PowerShell retries a connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received
Specifies the interval between retries for the connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received
Specifies how many times PowerShell redirects a connection to an alternate Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) before the connection fails. A value of 0 (zero) prevents all redirection.
Sets the SSL/TLS protocols that are permissible for the web request. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0 and support for Tls13 was added in PowerShell 7.1.
Indicates the test shouldn't use a proxy to reach the destination. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0.
The path to directory containing target markdown files
If specified, recurse in to the path specified by Path parameter
Specifies how long the request can be pending before it times out
Specifies how many times PowerShell retries a connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received
Specifies the interval between retries for the connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received
Specifies how many times PowerShell redirects a connection to an alternate Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) before the connection fails. A value of 0 (zero) prevents all redirection.
Sets the SSL/TLS protocols that are permissible for the web request. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0 and support for Tls13 was added in PowerShell 7.1.
Indicates the test shouldn't use a proxy to reach the destination. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Verify TypeName and OutputType are referring to same type

This test case is to ensure object output typename is referring to same type as at least one of the types described by the OutputType attribute. Comparison is case sensitive for the matching typename part. TypeName and OutputType including equality test is printed to console

maml:Description.maml:para: The actual .NET type that some function returns
Commandlet or function name for which to retrieve OutputType attribute values.
The actual .NET type that some function returns
Commandlet or function name for which to retrieve OutputType attribute values.
